text: Most efficient way to search the last x lines of a file in python
I have a file and I don't know how big it's going to be (it could be quite large, but the size will vary greatly).
I want to search the last 10 lines or so to see if any of them match a string.
I need to do this as quickly and efficiently as possible and was wondering if there's anything better than:

code:
s = "foo"
last_bit = fileObj.readlines()[-10:]
for line in last_bit:
    if line == s:
        print "FOUND"
